Hints & Hauls: Sour, Saison, and Funk Round 15!

Discussion in 'Beer-It-Forward' started by Hot Dog Sandwich, Aug 16, 2018 at 1:21 PM.

Watch Thread
Page 1 of 35
1 2 3 4 5 35 Next >

  1. Hot Dog Sandwich Previously The Ryan

    Joined:
    Oct 24, 2013
    Location:
    Yes
    Page:
    1
    Post ID:
    1849327
    Date:
    2018-08-16 13:21
    https://media.giphy.com/media/YbQG36qspycX6/giphy.gif

    Hints and Hauls thread for Sour, Saison, and Funk Round 15! Post hints for your sender and target; along with general shenanigans.

    The rules:

    A box filled with lambic, wild ales, berliners, saisons, farmhouse ales, goses, etc., as well as anything else that is rustic or funky.
    • A 6 bottle shipper*
    • All beers must be an rAvg of 4.0 or higher or a 'want' by your target.**
    • Try to find fun and exciting bottles/growlers that your target otherwise wouldn't likely be able to try
    • Quantity is good, quality is better!
    * ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
    **If you can't hit wants, please try to find fun stuff that your target otherwise wouldn't likely be able to try.

    Shipping deadline: Monday, October 1st

    If you fail to ship by the deadline without a prior heads up, you will receive negative feedback.

  145. nothingisreal

    lanesvfire said: > ↑ >
    >
    That looks like an etre order. I got my first box coming as well with some of that honey goodness. How long does it typically take to get stateside?
    >
     
    We got it distro'd over here in CA, though 3F, the distributor or Shelton Brothers did not differentiate the boxes. So some spots got full orders of only lavender & honey blend A&G or regular A&G. We asked the distributor to go through the left over cases they had, when I found a bottle at a shop out here.

    But usually Etre/BiAB orders get delivered pretty quick once they pass customs. that EMS shipping, reminds me of ordering shit from Japan.

  190. lanesvfire

    Joined:
    Aug 10, 2016
    Location:
    Stillman Valley,...
    Page:
    10
    Post ID:
    1855963
    Date:
    2018-08-27 17:24
    KevSal said: > ↑ >
    >
    Im actually surprised by how many people put down dark sours as a dislike....
    >
    > you guys are missing out!
    >
     
    I'm just not a fan of most of the malt bills in dark sours. I really like the lemony brightness and fruit (if there is) to really shine through on blonde base sours. I'll appreciate a beer for its style but I just don't prefer darker malts in my sours. To each their own though.

  194. mwbbq

    2018-08-27 21:43
    Sorry for making everyone wait. But some sour and funky Pron is finally here courtesy of Ben!

    First up
    https://i.imgur.com/L8gCKQO.jpg

    Wow! Flora blueberry, blackcurrant, raspberry, and cherry
    Flora Pear
    And Tired Hands Works of Love! All look tasty.

    Next up
    https://i.imgur.com/Mmk1Wze.jpg

    More Hill Farmstead! LoG 4/16/16 wine BA IPA
    Flora cherry, raspberry, and northern kiwi
    Juicy! Hopefully this is a hazy IPA!

    And then...
    https://i.imgur.com/S99sTeB.jpg

    Even more Hill Farmstead!
    LoG 9/18/15 wine ba gooseberry and northern kiwi ... x2! One for me and one for IrishColonial so we dont have to share
    And Civil Disobedience Citrus!

    And finally,
    https://i.imgur.com/NW1VqUu.jpg

    Aaron Burr Cidery's Neversink Highlands, a dry cider made from wild apples - sounds crazy!
    Civil Disobedience 21 blend of lots of beers
    Civil Disobedience 24 superblend including Residency beers among many others

    Family picture!
    https://i.imgur.com/q0vpDZe.jpg

    Damn Ben, this is so awesome, thanks a million. Both IrishColonial and I are huge fans of Hill, and we like to share new HF beers with each other already. These are going to be enjoyed very soon!

    > Even more Hill Farmstead!
    > LoG 9/18/15 wine ba gooseberry and northern kiwi ... x2! One for me and one for IrishColonial so we dont have to share
    > And Civil Disobedience Citrus!
    >
    > And finally,
    > https://i.imgur.com/NW1VqUu.jpg >
    >
    > Aaron Burr Cidery's Neversink Highlands, a dry cider made from wild apples - sounds crazy!
    > Civil Disobedience 21 blend of lots of beers
    > Civil Disobedience 24 superblend including Residency beers among many others
    >
    > Family picture!
    > https://i.imgur.com/q0vpDZe.jpg >
    >
    > Damn Ben, this is so awesome, thanks a million. Both IrishColonial and I are huge fans of Hill, and we like to share new HF beers with each other already. These are going to be enjoyed very soon!
    >
     

    Six bottle shipper checks out

    Target - I went to Oddwood today and grabbed you a crowler of a blended beer with a hoppy blonde and foeder aged wild. I enjoyed the hell out of it and found it quite refreshing and I'm hoping you enjoy it as well. I'm off Tuesday, I might be able to carve sometime out to pack and ship then for a Friday/Saturday delivery... Depends on what my wife and daughter have planned though.

    Sender -
    https://media.giphy.com/media/12CWXqQNF6rhJK/giphy.gif

  258. brystmar

    Seattle

    13
    Post ID:
    1861468
    Date:
    2018-09-07 13:17
    Target: I've been slacking here, but your box is coming along nicely. Visiting a new brewery this weekend that just released their first bottle. Want one?

    https://i0.wp.com/gardenpathwa.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Flowered.png?resize=768%2C409&ssl;=1
    >
    As of last Friday, we finally have our first bottles in stock. The Garden Paths Led to Flowered is a 7.0% abv hoppy golden ale open-fermented in a foudre, blended with barrel-aged beer, and naturally conditioned with blackberry honey from The Valley’s Buzz. You may have had it on tap already, whether at Garden Path or at a handful of other accounts, but now you can actually take it home with you. We packaged about 700 bottles, which are now available in our tasting room for $14, currently with no bottle limits.
    >
    > The label art for “Flowered”, as we like to call it, is by our own Scout Caldwell, whose art also decorates our tasting room walls, and who is doing well in Portland, but whom we miss dearly. The graphic design was also done in-house by our Operations Lead Jacob Grisham, who seems to have literally all the skills. The federal label approval was done by the Federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax & Trade Bureau, affectionately known as the TTB.
    >

    1934 Zombie did me in a few weeks ago at one of the storied Tiki Bars in SF, a favorite of Anthony Bourdain. It has been around since the 1945s, my grandparents use to enjoy the same drink back then.

    https://cdn.vox-cdn.com/uploads/chorus_asset/file/3344860/TongaRoom_PChang-3.0.jpg

    Drinks are ranked on a scale of hashmarks and skulls. The Zombie is three of each. I was seeing double boats above by the bottom of it. Well that and the other drinks, bowls with comically long straws, and the edibles.

    Jumped on to write the post after work yesterday... then the wife dragged me out for drinks. Sorry for leaving you hanging this long -- doubly so when you bombed my porch this hard . My slowness to post the haul + the raging wood in my pants from unboxing everything means it's time to tighten that chastity belt.

    Dude. You bombed me with lambic. Real lambic, not that bullshit midwest swill.

    The wide boys:
    https://www.talkbeer.com/community/attachments/ssf15-2-sm-jpg.435/

    Oddwood IHO -- Was bummed they weren't open last time I was in Austin. Excited for this one.
    2018 MvB -- Among my fav JK fruits
    2018 Atrial -- Perpetual ISO; can't get enough of this stuff.
    2017 Cantillon Kriek (!) -- My fav straight-up kriek. This will be enjoyed in the near future.
    2016 3F OG -- Simply the best gueuze out there.

    Small bangers:
    https://www.talkbeer.com/community/attachments/ssf15-1-sm-jpeg.434/

    Guessing that's homemade BBQ sauce? Looks delish!!
    Homebrew?? Spill the deets! Got this in the fridge already, next to the BBQ sauce.
    2018 SPON Blubbers & Dragons -- Enjoyed the 2017, looking forward to this one
    2017 Oude Kriek -- Gonna side-by-side this with the Kriekenlambik.
    2017 Oude Kriekenlambik (!) -- New tick! Pumped to crack this one. I wonder why they used brown bottles for this but not the Oude Kriek.
    2017 Tilquin goozie -- Love love love
    2012 (!!) 3F OG -- Hell. Yes.

    Killer box, ExPimp! This is the most lambic I've ever received in a BIF/trade; I'm humbled. Thank you thank you thank you!
    https://media.giphy.com/media/AqEUAOCWjoU5W/giphy.gif
    Whoa indeed, girl from MTV. Whoa indeed.
     


  305. Hot Dog Sandwich

    Joined:
    Oct 24, 2013
    Location:
    Yes
    Page:
    16
    Post ID:
    1864939
    Date:
    2018-09-13 16:01
    brystmar said: > ↑ >
    >
    https://media.giphy.com/media/AqEUAOCWjoU5W/giphy.gif >
    > Whoa indeed, girl from MTV. Whoa indeed.
    >
     
    That is

    Lauren Katherine Tell (née Conrad; born February 1, 1986)[1] is an American television personality, fashion designer, and author. In September 2004, an 18-year-old Conrad came to prominence after being cast in the reality television series Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County, which documented her and her friends' lives in their hometown of Laguna Beach, California.

    Conrad later moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in the fashion industry, and received her own spin-off series The Hills in May 2006. It followed the personal and professional lives of her and friends Heidi Montag, Audrina Patridge, and Whitney Port. As the series progressed, a widely publicized feud between Conrad, Montag, and Montag's boyfriend Spencer Pratt became the central focus of the series, and was carried through each subsequent season in which Conrad was featured. During its production, she also attended the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising and worked for Teen Vogue and Kelly Cutrone's PR firm People's Revolution. Conrad left The Hills after five seasons, and was replaced by former Laguna Beach co-star Kristin Cavallari in May 2009. She filmed an alternate ending for the series finale in July 2010, which was broadcast in August 2013.

    Conrad is the founder of the fashion lines LC Lauren Conrad and Paper Crown, and the co-founder of the fair trade online store The Little Market. She has published nine books, including L.A. Candy and The Fame Game trilogies. Conrad married former musician and law school graduate William Tell in September 2014; they have one child together.

In September 2004, an 18-year-old Conrad came to prominence after being cast in the reality television series Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County, which documented her and her friends' lives in their hometown of Laguna Beach, California.
    >

It followed the personal and professional lives of her and friends Heidi Montag, Audrina Patridge, and Whitney Port. As the series progressed, a widely publicized feud between Conrad, Montag, and Montag's boyfriend Spencer Pratt became the central focus of the series, and was carried through each subsequent season in which Conrad was featured. During its production, she also attended the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising and worked for Teen Vogue and Kelly Cutrone's PR firm People's Revolution. Conrad left The Hills after five seasons, and was replaced by former Laguna Beach co-star Kristin Cavallari in May 2009. She filmed an alternate ending for the series finale in July 2010, which was broadcast in August 2013.

My slowness to post the haul + the raging wood in my pants from unboxing everything means it's time to tighten that chastity belt.
    >
    > Dude. You bombed me with lambic. Real lambic, not that bullshit midwest swill.
    >
    > The wide boys:
    > View attachment 435 >
    >
    > Oddwood IHO -- Was bummed they weren't open last time I was in Austin. Excited for this one.
    > 2018 MvB -- Among my fav JK fruits
    > 2018 Atrial -- Perpetual ISO; can't get enough of this stuff.
    > 2017 Cantillon Kriek (!) -- My fav straight-up kriek. This will be enjoyed in the near future.
    > 2016 3F OG -- Simply the best gueuze out there.
    >
    > Small bangers:
    > View attachment 434 >
    >
    > Guessing that's homemade BBQ sauce? Looks delish!!
    > Homebrew?? Spill the deets! Got this in the fridge already, next to the BBQ sauce.
    > 2018 SPON Blubbers & Dragons -- Enjoyed the 2017, looking forward to this one
    > 2017 Oude Kriek -- Gonna side-by-side this with the Kriekenlambik.
    > 2017 Oude Kriekenlambik (!) -- New tick! Pumped to crack this one. I wonder why they used brown bottles for this but not the Oude Kriek.
    > 2017 Tilquin goozie -- Love love love
    > 2012 (!!) 3F OG -- Hell. Yes.
    >
    > Killer box, ExPimp! This is the most lambic I've ever received in a BIF/trade; I'm humbled. Thank you thank you thank you!
    > https://media.giphy.com/media/AqEUAOCWjoU5W/giphy.gif >
    > Whoa indeed, girl from MTV. Whoa indeed.
    >
     

    Yay, he lives! Glad to hear you're pleased with the box, I read through a ton of your untappd check ins to find those few new ones and try and hit some higher rated repeat ticks. I think I read the difference between the brown and green glass on the new 3F bottles is that the brown used only 3F wort, while the green still have blenders lambics? Something like that, I'm sure lambic.info has more info, but my memory is hazy and google-fu is weak atm. The mason jar is my Roasty Ghosty hot sauce, roasted veggies with ghost chilies to heat it. The home brew was my first all grain saison from January 2017 that had mix of dregs (HF/HM/SARA) and yeast. I drank a bottle before sending it out and think it's aging well. Cheers!

  394. cornboy

    Joined:
    Oct 18, 2016
    Location:
    CA
    Page:
    20
    Post ID:
    1871703
    Date:
    2018-09-23 15:12
    capnmike ... man what the fuck!! Thanks so much! You weren’t kidding about the box being huge. Great selection and all new ticks. A great spread of local and non-local offerings. First the small format:

    https://i.imgur.com/1u9oamS_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape;=thumb&fidelity;=medium

    Couple of funky cans, some clean “extras”, off color purple corn / berry beer, zero hop “spring tonic” mixed ferm beer. Think I’ve only ever had off color and 2nd shift before, never heard of the others except for Scratch. A really fun selection to go through here! Next the medium format:

    https://i.imgur.com/iA3Rkba_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape;=thumb&fidelity;=medium

    Allagash dark sour (bottled sept ‘16!), oude kriekenlambic , afterthought raspberry, lager / spontaneous ferm blend, foeder-aged (!!) saison with peaches. Most excited about the afterthought from this bunch, been wanting to try these for awhile. Always always always welcome to more 3F and any weirdo beers like the dovetail. I don’t drink enough allagash or dark sours so that’s a nice surprise! Last the large format:

    https://i.imgur.com/ZHqiBuT_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape;=thumb&fidelity;=medium

    Just damn. So much good stuff here! More scratch and off color, one with juniper berries in the boil and the other wine-barrel fermented with strawberries. And lastly more lambic. Mûre has been a long time want of mine, thanks so much for this!! And loons on top of all of this, Mike you’re crazy. Everything is a new tick even though I didn’t give you the best info to go off of. Can’t thank you enough. This is going to be a very fun box to work through. I will be in CHI early next year, we’ll be in touch... return fire coming.

    Cellarmaker Mango/Mosaic , sounds like a perfect combo
    Cellarmaker 4:1 Nectarine, 4lb to gallon should do it for sure
    Fieldwork More idols than realities , apricots and tangerines!
    Fueldwork Dressing in thoughts from skies, many fruit mahn
    All new tikk ‘s Stoked!
    https://i.imgur.com/cRaCZYu.jpg
    3F armand gaston blend n17 season 16/17
    3Foude geuze 2012!!!!!
    Sloambic batch 9
    Beatification 030118,never have had one to call my own, thank you!
    https://i.imgur.com/ivuLtS1.jpg
    West Ashley!!!!!!!!
    SARA Wondermutt
    Terreux Room for more, masumoto peach and nectarines. Masumoto is the real deal.
    Bruery The Wanderer 2013!

    KevSal thank you so much! Who told you i love stone fruit beers so much?

  450. mcgrupp1922

    Joined:

    Post ID:
    1876308
    Date:
    2018-09-28 15:30
    cornboy blew me away!! Extremely generous box of a ton of new beers I've wanted to try for some time along with some favorites.

    https://i.imgur.com/hW6bqhe.jpg

    Firestone Walker Under Currant - New tick, love black currants!
    3f A&G blend 56 - New blend tick and absolutely love this beer!

    Now Trevor claims he didn't realize he was doing this but both of these Urban Roots beers are Phish references which I obviously love!

    No one taught that to me yet - Spelt Saison
    Tomorrow's Verse - amazing label artwork for this saison!

    https://i.imgur.com/sIvO1Kv.jpg

    Holy Mountain Vesper - Table beer, new tick
    SARA Cellarman B6 - Always a favorite
    SARA Cask Strawberry B7 - best strawberry beer out there by far!
    SARA Much Appreciated!! - So excited for this, was wanting to trade/hunt this down when they released it.
    Tilquin Gueze 16/17 - Another favorite
    dG Nelson Hose - Great beer, could crush a lot of this
    Susucaru Rose - Had never heard of this but obviously love great wine! Excited to try this.
    SARA/Side Project Matrices - Cant wait to try this!

    Thank you again cornboy going to crack some of these this weekend!

    SARAxCycle Tandem (!!!)

    Side Project Trifecta:

    https://i.imgur.com/I1gV5Pg.jpg

    Merci Blend #3 (I think)
    Biere du Pays
    Merci Blend #4 (I think)

    https://media.giphy.com/media/12qMRa6NNmJRp6/giphy.gif

    And also...All. Of. The. Jester King.

    https://i.imgur.com/jsMqmzT.jpg

    Fen Tao
    Atrial
    Aurelian
    ??? (It was grapes and I can't find it on the website)
    O&P
    MvB

    So many fruits so little time!

    Thank you IrishColonial and mwbbq! I just got tag teamed in the best way possible. I don't usually list specific wants during BiFs but I did for this one mentioning Side Project and if you went out of your way to acquire them for me or let go of some bottles you were holding on to I can't thank you guys enough.

    https://media.giphy.com/media/NI4FNMb4tJEYM/giphy.gif

    Fantastic box from nachojon! First off, thank you for sending lots of brewery favorites and new ticks.

    All shots from rustic AF french table from the 1910s. Check out my albino frame and black polo in the reflection too for them extra memory faps.

    https://media.giphy.com/media/ifuqvLuaJg2oo/giphy.gif

    First up, the spontaneous funky cow turds from the Goonies coast
    https://i.imgur.com/A4mf9TT.jpg

    Citra Hose
    Framboise
    Purple
    Nelson Hose

    https://media.giphy.com/media/3oKIP8QzwUPvuxcIcU/giphy.gif

    Love the dry hopped hose series, looking forward to trying the new batch of dat Purple, and Framboise has me salivating.

    Remainder of the lovely, funky northern neighbor's box
    https://i.imgur.com/5fXkXGb.jpg

    https://media.giphy.com/media/dANm7WjeWZi00/giphy.gif

    Two hoppy tins that will help with BBQ tonight
    Vesper, Four Hands, Monocole (Monkish x Other Half collaboration), and E9 Brewery. Lots of favorite styles and breweries.

    Thank you!

    https://media.giphy.com/media/l4FGp8PkoEdEQo9gY/giphy.gif

    De Struise - Dark Horse Reserva: aged 4 years in Bordeaux barrels? holy moly that sounds cool.
    Floodland - Drive out of the Spirits: These guys just came on my radar. Have read fantastic things about their beer and was thinking about trying to get some... and now I get to try one!

    https://media.giphy.com/media/d2Zlbe97YmGvk0ec/giphy.gif

    https://i.imgur.com/cJQkvND.jpg

    De Garde - The Blackberry: All the blackberries!! and again, yaaaas De Garde!
    Drie Fonteinen - A&G: 3F has easily been my favorite gueuze, but its probably been 2+ years since I've last had some. So super stoked to see this in the box, and even more excited that it was A&G!

  606. Ben

    Joined:
    Oct 1, 2013
    Location:
    New Jersey
    Page:
    31
    Post ID:
    1883398
    Date:
    2018-10-08 16:57
    Sorry for the delay, but was busy drinking a lot of these bottles this weekend in celebration of my fiance's birthday. She loves sour beers so these checked all of the boxes and were a huge hit. When I put two and two together that Farnsworth was my sender my reaction:

    https://i.gifer.com/NpXW.gif

    Love my some Chicagoland-Area beers, so lets get into it...

    https://i.imgur.com/lLsrQMc.jpg

    First up: cans and tiny bottle.
    Energy City Brewing - Milkshake Nawi Mango: Consumed already, super tasty!
    Scratch Brewing - Spring Tonic
    Saint Errant Brewing - Hands of Fate: Consumed already, would bang again.

    https://i.imgur.com/T7aIIQk.jpg

    Second: Mid-sized bottles
    Black Project - Gnomon: Consumed already, this has me very excited to be out in Denver for the Festival in two weeks!
    Afterthought - Fruited Beers (sorry can not remember the fruits off the top of my head but they all looked delicious!)
    Transient - Foeder 2 Electric Boogaloo: Consumed already, I absolutely love Transient bottles, thanks to touching trade tips with Treebs many times in the past.

    https://i.imgur.com/q1p4ZOG.jpg

    Third: Big bottles
    Side Project - Biere de Pays: Really underrated bottle from SP, love!
    Scratch Brewing Co. - Barrel-Aged Cedar Oak: Love Gin, can't wait to see what the juniper does on this.
    Transient - Balaton - CHERRIES
    Transient - Montemorency - MOAR CHERRIES
    Black Project - Supercruise - See above for Festival excitement.

    Overall killer box, can't wait to get into the rest of theses over the next few weekends. After having to step away from this BIF for a while, I am so glad to be back.

    https://i.imgur.com/C2XZQt8.gif

    Since this BIF is the best in the game, I’d like to run a LIF within a BIF.

    I was at HF two weeks ago for an annual trip with a couple buddies and was lucky enough to get an allotment of Florence Puncheon. If you’re interested in a bottle, take a stab at the date and time my son was born (edit it was in 2015 — I’ll give you the year) . Winner that gets the closest without going over will win the Florence punchone and whatever else I feel like including

  640. nophunk

    Joined:
    May 9, 2014
    Location:
    504
    Page:
    32
    Post ID:
    1885705
    Date:
    2018-10-11 20:24
    https://www.talkbeer.com/community/attachments/img_5104-jpg.1239/ ABSTRACTlegend my dad was doing some work at my house and "wanted a beer." I literally have nothing crushable in 12 ounce format, so I was like let's split something lol. He said "it's different." He's pretty green on sours, but he liked it enough to get a second pour.

    These black/red raspberry jawns always have an interesting tartness. Just drank an American Solera a week ago, and they always have this profile. This one is actually a little more balanced which is nice. Thanks man!

  642. cornboy

    Joined:
    Oct 18, 2016
    Location:
    CA
    Page:
    33
    Post ID:
    1885868
    Date:
    2018-10-11 23:35
    Opened a few capnmike beers this week.

    https://i.imgur.com/9g030ki_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape;=thumb&fidelity;=medium

    Total fucking weirdo beer and I love it. This one was a hopless wild ale bittered with ginger, carrot tips, clove, and dandelion. Probably would have gone well with food. After this I’m really looking forward to the other beer from Scratch that he sent!

    https://i.imgur.com/OsRi2JQ_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape;=thumb&fidelity;=medium

    I was on many SN oktoberfests when I had this so not much to say other than it had a nice fluffy mouthfeel and wasn’t too acidic.

    https://i.imgur.com/DV5j7mv_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape;=thumb&fidelity;=medium

    Raspberry ale beer. No idea what the base for this is but it fucks. I’ve been wanting to try afterthought for awhile and this did not disappoint. Thanks again for the great beers capnmike !! All of the small format beers outside of 3F kriekenlambik have been consumed, need to start working my way through the big stuff soon.

    Thanks, MikeJones I don't know how this box could be any better... unreal.

    The non-Jersey terroir...
    https://i.imgur.com/l9nWZiZ.jpg
    Anna- one of my favorites, never had this batch.
    Clara- a HF "shelfie" that I haven't tried, it's in the fridge.
    Plan Bee Bartlett- have only had one Plan Bee and it was great, this one should be even better.

    Mini NJ terroir...
    https://i.imgur.com/nBykPs4.jpg
    All from The Referend... hnnnnnggggg
    The Revolutionists Stop for Orangeade- So fucking stoked to have another one of these.
    Krek!- Yes.
    Smultronstället- Strawberries...Yess.
    Locus Socus- Port barrel... Yesss.
    Tender Buttons Vanilla- WHAT THE FUCK YESSSSS.
    The Name of the Rose- One of the best things I tasted at BFNA.

    The Bigs.
    https://i.imgur.com/Prb19UG.jpg
    Berliner Messe Sanctus- Grapes!
    Berliner Messe Alleluiavers- Peaches, had last years and it was incredible.
    Tender Buttons- huge want.

    Family Photo-
    https://i.imgur.com/cmr0c0q.jpg

    https://media.giphy.com/media/E4pJ3LAVLUMrC/giphy.gif

    I’m not sure if I ever LOVED rain, but at worst, I used to be indifferent.

    Then I got a house with an unpaved alley, which means no sewer, which means my yard floods, and I got a kid who wants to play football/baseball catch outside all the time, and I got a long-haired cartoon-style dog, who digs up said muddy yard....now I kind of want to move to Arizona.
